casebody.data:
SCHAFF v. SHELTON. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. December 15, 1917.) No. 3132. Appeal from the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Texas; Duval West, Judge. William E. Spell, of Waco, Tex., for appellant. Winbourne Pearce, of Temple, Tex., and A. L. Curtis, of Bell on, Tex., for appellee.

Before WALKER and BATTS, Circuit Judges, and'FOSTER, District Judge.

PER CURIAM.

The only ruling of the court which the record presents for review is in conformity with repeated authoritative rulings. There is no merit in either of the assignments of error. The judgment is afiirmed.
